title: McDonald’s gets a French makeover with croissants, chocolatines
text:
Call it Le Big Mac.
A new French-inspired McDonald’s has landed in Chelsea with a certain je ne sais quoi — freshly baked Parisian sweets like croissants and chocolatines on display.
You can now get a croissant at McDonald's. (Susan Watts/New York Daily News) The super-sized burger chain called in French designer Patrick Norguet to stylize its golden arches to make it less about branding and more about a real restaurant experience. That means a sleek interior with an open counter ordering area, redesigned kitchen and posh, high top red chairs.
"Everything about this restaurant model — from the layout, to the table service, to our new menu offerings — is focused on the customer," said Franchisee PJ Fonseca.
"This model emphasizes simplicity to set the stage for a different kind of McDonald's experience."
McDonald's launches a French-inspired restaurant concept at 809 6th Avenue in Chelsea. (Susan Watts/New York Daily News) Guests are greeted by a restaurant host and can order from kiosks built into the wall. Customers can browse fancy menu items like a new apple pie with a lattice crust, blueberry muffin toppers, raspberry petite pastries and a cinnamon coffee cake perfect for pairing with the freshly brewed McCafe espresso.
The Signature Crafted items feature a line of savory chicken sandwiches, like the maple bacon dijon variety, and burgers that can be customized with toppings.
Cinnamon Coffee Cake - McDonald's launches a French-inspired restaurant concept at 809 6th Avenue in Chelsea offering customers a new experience on Wednesday February 8, 2017 - (Susan Watts/New York Daily News) (Susan Watts/New York Daily News) And, of course, it wouldn’t be Mickey Dee’s without a selection of new Big Macs, like the double cheesy, extra beefy, Grand Mac topped with special sauce, lettuce, onions and pickles.
